short_desc: Emergency shelter offers 30 beds for single adults and families. Serves anyone who self-identifies as having no appropriate place to live. Apply by phone
description: The Second Chance Emergency Shelter is a multi-purpose shelter which provides 30 beds for single adults and families. Serves anyone not having an appropriate place to live. There is no other requirement, although the program has a special focus on persons in recovery from drug and alcohol problems. Basic stay is two weeks for singles and three weeks for families. Flexibility  depends on residents' particular situation. Basic services include bed, three meals daily, laundry, telephone and mail drop. Also provides information to community resources and support services. Subject to availability, shelter provides limited access for non-residents to shower, do laundry and eat an evening meal,.
